reviews.sentence: Genuinely LOVED our stay. I loved your hotel. I had stay again. We had a small issue with the TV in our room. The response to resolve was outstanding. THANK YOU. I have not had that experience before. The group genuinely cares. Thank you also for the extended pool hours. Nice to have that available. Most hotels do not provide swimming past the time you provide. THANK YOU again. The only negative is the begs are too small for two people. We had signed up for 4 and would have more than likely have chose another place if we had known just how small the begs were. it is gorgeous and peaceful. Great place for a family or business provided a family of 3 or more gets two connecting rooms. Either change the full size beds to queen size or create a warning on your website.
Good price far from downtown Chicago. pools amazing pilowsno bad experiences.

Huge Indoor Pool. The Room was Small for a Family but Small Refrigerator in a Room Convenient. The breakfast in the club lounge was great. The breakfast buffet on the first floor was very crowded mainly because there is only one line to get food. It was a very awkward set up. The room had a small refrigerator and convenient but was a bit small for my family. 542. I liked a small living area by an elevator. Loved the huge indoor pool that is partially connected to the outdoor pool.

Beautiful hotel with huge rooms. From the outside it did n’t look like much. However the hotel was very large and beautiful on the inside. I loved the large teepee floor lamps in the lobby and the color scheme throughout. It had a very warm feeling. There were also a couple of nice courtyards with seating including one that contained one of the pools. The hotel had a barber a coffee and pastry stand and a full scale restaurant as you would expect for this caliber of hotel. The restaurant provided good service but the quality of the food was just “ OK”. The hotel housed several pools both indoor and outdoor. We decided not to use the facilities due to the number of kids in all the pools. Each floor had a large central seating area next to the elevators. There were four hallways to the rooms that radiated out from there. The rooms were very large. I really liked the entry into the room with the table next to the door to lay down keys and wallet. The placement of the table made it appear a little more grand. The room had a significantly large sized sofa. The bed was very comfortable. The tiled and partially glassed in shower stall was a classy touch. No door to close and you just walked into it. Very nice and modern hardware in the shower and vanity. The TV reception was good. They offered a number of channels with a mixture of HD and analog reception. The wifi signal was somewhat weak. We asked for a refrigerator to keep sodas in and were accommodated. The hotel is located adjacent to Expressway 53 major shopping and numerous restaurants representing all price points.

Good choice in the Chicago suburbs for business and leisure travelers. Solid suburban Hyat Regency. Good location in Schaumburg not far from OHare and close to many stores and restaurants and roads. Large lobby with lots of seating and a good sized lobby bar. Starbucks coffee also available in the lobby. Reasonable pricing. Rooms are good. Clean. Nice size. A C worked well on a hot July day. Plenty of close in parking. Front desk staff pleasant and efficient upon check in. Gym is a good size. Indoor and outdoor pools for swimmers. Good choice for both business and leisure travelers.
We loved our stay at the Hyat. The best part was the swimming pools. It was great.

Great place. Enjoyed our stay. Very nice hotel with many things to offer. Indoor Outdoor pool Resturant with a lounge. Great location with lots of good restaurants close shopping malls within close proximity. Totally enjoyed our stay look forward to visiting again.

The bartender in the evening is awesome. He took responsibility and knew when to cut a guy off. He was also very nice about it. The food both breakfast and dinner are fantastic. The staff in general is great. The front desk is more than accommodating and hotel service crew will do what you ask. The pool is clean and while the gym is simply a hotel gym it accommodated me very well and i work out 5 days a week. Definitely would stay here again.

Good experience for 3 days stay. I went swimming on my first arrival and the outdoor pool was perfect. You can also swim underwater to the indoor side. No hot tub though. The staff is very attentive. My room was difficult to find. The check in staff should provide a printed map. The hallway where my room was located did not have an intuitive placement of the sign to guide me. I had a great experience I cam down to the front desk to get a complimentary toothpaste. The day after next the housekeeper gave me a travel size tube even though I was to check out the next day classy.
I have stayed here many times and it is always top notch. I miss the hot tub that they removed. The indoor pool still remains and the breakfast is always great.

Had an internship confrence here the hotel staff was wonderful. They were extremely friendly and on top of everything. The pool was underwhelming but hey its a hotel. Personally I enjoyed the catering a lot all the food was deicious especially the wild mushroom pizza. YUM.

Great location updated facility lackluster front desk. The wait staff at breakfast was terrific. Very attentive and quick to satisfy. The room was clean with just a few exceptions. Check out went smoothly the location was terrific for we were pretty centralized to what we wanted to do and the hotel itself was pretty updated with lots of technology. Right from the beginning we had to kinda fight for what we paid for. At arrival the woman seemed confused by our reservation through Bokingcom. After 15 minutes she gave us our keys and after a little prodding a general idea on where to park for our room. We picked this hotel because it was close to the mall had breakfast that we could pay for as part of our stay offered shuttle service and had a pool. We did not utilize the shuttle service the pool heater had broken and was not told until we got down there and saw the sign and we had to go to the front desk in the morning to once again ask the confused front desk about getting vouchers for the breakfast we paid for. Then after waiting she answered her phone and walkie talkie several times in the middle of our conversation. The breakfast was particularly sad. The eggs were flavorles the pancakes were cold and falling apart the sausage was of a meat I could not distinguish however the bacon and toast were good. The wait staff was exceptional but when we used our vouchers I noticed it would of cost us 20 a person plus tax for this sad breakfast. Also allowing someone that works at your hotel to run a car vacuum to clean a car right outside the rooms early and before checkout was a huge turnoff.

Computers were down at nonish when I went to check in. Later after walking in a convention all day I wanted to relax no bathtub so let ’s hit the hot tub. That was broken down with no warning on the website. And the pool heater was broken as well. The shower in the room was in desperate need of a new shower head. And the wire rack for the soaps was loose. The employees were the only redeeming quality of the hotel.

Liked the location and friendliness of the staff. Near shops great city works restaurant right there. Generally rooms were clean. Easy access to visit my family who I came to visit. Did not get chance to use pool.

Room was dirty there were fake nails left over from a previous guest on the couch. Indoor pool was cloudy and the water smelled brackish. Outdoor pool was n’t open yet despite it being late June. Staff was rude with poor customer service skills. Also I left something behind in my room and when I called to check lost and found I could never get through to them even after calling 4 separate times they would not get back to me. Finally I had to speak with a manager to get them to actually check and when they did check they said they did n’t have my item even though I am 100 positive where it was left behind. I travel to this area frequently but will never again consider staying at this hotel. One of the poorest experiences I ’ve had.

Unexpectedly disappointed. We have been going to this hotel for years. Have always loved to go in the summer especially and enjoy their nice outdoor pool and pool area. We were very surprised to find out when we arrived that the pool was closed this summer. I had been on the hotel website and I rechecked it. no where is it mentioned that the pool and hot tub were not available. We were just coming into the Chicago area for the day on Sunday but decided to come a day early and stay at our favorite hotel. We thought we ’d enjoy the pool for awhile and then do some shopping. Got our suits on and went down and saw the sign on the pool door. Bummer.
Disappointed that pool was closed. Breakfast buffet was 190 each. Definitely not worth that amount of money.
Good. We went to stay there for Anniversary and lay by the outdoor pool. Was really bummed pool not open. I would have went somewhere else that had a pool. But it was a nice stay.

Big hotel. Rooms average. Small gym with an indoor pool. Breakfast was below average for a Hyat resort. There is a coffee downstairs with reasonable options of snacks sandwiches coffees etc. reception staff are very nice and friendly. Location is also reasonable.
